abstractText: The goal of aerial photography and photo points is to quantify project-wide changes in landform and vegetation patterns accompanying restoration. GIS-based measurements include site area; width, sinuosity, density, and total edge of tidal channels; as well as area and configuration of landforms and broad vegetation communities.
title: Landscape Features (aerial photography and photo points) Data Analysis - Roegner et al. 2009 v1.0
